Home

About FineST

FineST (Fine-grained Spatial Transcriptomic) is a statistical model and toolbox to identify the super-resolved spatial co-expression (i.e., spatial association) between a pair of ligand and receptor. It pulls data from the Open Food Facts database and offers a simple and intuitive API.

Uniquely, FineST can distinguish co-expressed ligand-receptor pairs (LR pairs) from spatially separating pairs at sub-spot level or single-cell level, and identify the super-resolved interaction.

Note

This project is under active development.

Please refer to our tutorials for details:

  • Sub-spot level prediction.

References

FineST manuscript with more details is available on bioRxiv now and is currently under review.
